data.text: I'm a Side Sleeper, I Need a New Insulated Pad for a Better Sleeping Comfort

Hey! Anyone a side sleeper? Post-winter prepping reminded me to replace my sleeping pad, with one that can better handle my sleeping on my side and the aging body that is needing more comfort as the years go by. Recommendations?

data.text: I won't Winter Camp anymore, and the knees won't allow backpacking. So I'm mostly doing cycle touring and kayak trips. I don't have a budget in mind yet. I'm 6ft tall. In the old days I used to use a shorty and that would probably still be okay.
data.author: Randy Haluza-delay

data.text: I use an inflatable mattress, it takes a bit longer to blow-up and let-down but it packs very small AND your hip does not dig into the ground. I also successfully used a self inflating mattress (and added a few extra puffs of air). Get one with anti-slip features if you can ; or use cotton shirts etc to increase the friction of the slippery sleeping bag on the mattress
data.author: Dane Hardinge

data.text: Big Agnes Insulated Air Core. I also use a cheap inflatable pillow between my knees which I find helps alleviate some knee/hip pressure.

data.text: Your best bet by far is : Therm-a-Rest Trail Pro - Isomatte //this matress is 7.6 cm thick . when you lie down on the full inflated matress, go on side position and let some air out til your hip almost touches the ground. this way the matress will take the shape of your body and you will sleep like a baby. This matress is self inflated and shy over a kilo the large one. the big advantage is that you don`t need to blow it humid every evening then it will remain fungus free inside. You can have (therma rest NeoAir Xlite Isomatte) 425 grs. and 6.4 cm thick one but you need to blow it yourself (with a bag on the valvle) , less than 6 cm wont be as comfy. If you need to block the cold from the ground there are some extremely light weight foam blankets coated with Alu on both sides and it doesn`t get wet. i use them as a foot print. you can see it on the pic below.
